u87Vavef_WRrftXlCC_v8g.text: Birdie is the best!! I come to Lolos all the time and I only come back for Birdie! Not only does she let us try her specialty cocktails but she provides the best experience! I can't wait to bring in more friends to meet Birdie and have countless really good days!!

bo53cxUqZ2szXHPzc76Bjw.text: Not cool Lo-Lo's, the food took 40 minutes and without apologies.  In addition, we were missing items, like eggs and grits that are part of the order.   Your food is good, but not good enough to overlook the poor service.

TSdVpA0HwEbYQJ27HzYxUA.text: I've got to admit, their fried chicken is pretty tasty. And combined with pure sugar aka the maple syrup with the waffles, you got yourself some good food. Is it healthy? Ohhhhh HELLLL NO. But delicious? Yes. They have different dishes but you basically get the same thing whatever you order... a piece or two of chicken and a type of waffles. A little expensive for some basic things but hey! If you like chicken and waffles, this is a good place to get it. It's kind of a salty and sweet thing. Good contrast!

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 2 thighs and waffle

lrF5rw_kI8NAyqLl-5z39g.text: Megan, our server, was friendly,  prompt, and very helpful!  We had the Fried chicken gizzards - tender inside, crispy outside and not at all gamey tasting. I also highly recommend the chicken fried chicken (the gravy is tasty) and collared greens (nice balance of sweet and bitter). The fried chicken was good (crispy batter and juicy meat). My only reason for knocking down a star is that the waffle was not as crisp and was a bit thin.  Portions were huge but prices are not. See pics.

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lil Amadi - waffles with 2 pieces of chicken. Only $7.
Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken fried chicken with cornbread muffin. $15 including 2 sides. We got coleslaw and collared greens (not pictured).
Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Oreo pancakes with bacon. Other meat options arr sausage patties, hot links, and turkeu bacon.

bhVEWglxgId2wCPe0lhHuw.text: My husband and I ate here a few days ago. I had the Toy Toy which was was 3 chicken wings with waffles. My husband had the Lil Amadi which was two thighs and a waffle. The chicken was hot and crunchy....straight out of the grease. We arrived not long before closing and we didn't feel rushed at all. Great atmosphere. Our waiter was great. We enjoyed our food.

5l91BArkT5SeMNIehwytgg.text: I still love Lo-lo's after all this time. The parking is terrible! Let's get that out of the way as there is no way around it. The nearby hotel takes up all of the parking.  The good gets my 5 star review! We love the chicken and waffles here! The chicken is always perfectly cooked and the waffles light and fluffy.  The prices are reasonable and even thinking about it can make my mouth water.  I'm not a chicken and waffles kind of gal but when I want the best I come to Lo-lo's. They offer breakfast, lunch and dinner. Even the side dishes are homemade and the staff friendly and attentive. Go at "offpeak" times would be my biggest tip!

bSF7obzg57kbwxgJvGcktw.text: Felicia our server was great. She is really good with kids and held the baby while mom ate for a few minutes. For a soul food place it has a very modern feel. The koolaid is the bomb and the DJ booth is cool.

fWYL_z0ji_NpEFS3lDJ4yg.text: They redeemed themselves! Expect delays in ordering, but worth the wait. There were people at about 5 tables and 7 employees just standing around the bar talking. Even though we sat next to the kitchen entrance, waiters passed by us continuously and never stopped to get us drinks or take our order. It was happening to another table and the decided to leave. After about 12 minutes someone came over and asked if we were being neglected. He was an awesome waiter and every waiter in this world should strive to be like him. Friendly, understanding, knew the menu by heart, attentive, all-round great person! Lo-Lo's would have gotten 2 stars from me if it wasn't for him.  We came for the Chicken and only the chicken! He provided us with so many chicken options  for all of us to be satisfied with what we ordered the way we wanted it. He came back in less than 5 minutes with all the chicken. But how? So quick? We had such a variety of pieces ordered. I thought AH CRAP, pre-cooked, reheated, or microwaved! But it wasn't. It was very crispy outside, juicy inside, and the right temperature all around with a really good flavor. We don't know how the cooks did it and the waiter wouldn't tell us. And the Mac'n'cheese is thick and cheesy!!! It was so good!  When the bill came, my meal was missing. I called him over and told him the check was wrong and missing my meal. He said not to worry about it since we were neglected and wanted to make up for it. I said it was alright, the chicken made up for the wait. He insisted though. Next time we are in Scottsdale we will be back!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fried Chicken with Mac&#39;n&#39;Cheese and corn bread

9P1Lb2JlPEDUUMTNH8JeBg.text: We had a awesome waiter named Mike. Great service, great food and a relaxing lunch. Look forward to visiting this location here in Scottsdale Arizona real soon.

d1AK7oIXPmoq7IDRzudxyg.text: Being born and raised in Nashville, Tennessee, it has made it extremely hard to be lenient when it comes to soul food and my southern favorites. I'm from a city that is known for their music, hospitality and food (especially the hot chicken). In other words, I know good chicken like a choir director knows his keys.   After my experience at Lo-Lo's (twice now), I can definitely say this is as close to good soul food one is going to find here in The Valley. (that I have tried at least).  The chicken and waffles were pretty good, chicken could have had more seasoning and been crunchier but it was still edible and decent, waffle was alright but it could of been much fluffier. My side items were also lacking a little seasoning but like I said, this is Phoenix, AZ so we gotta accept what we have when it comes to soul food.  Lo-Lo's is not the best in the food department but the service is OUTSTANDING. My server my last visit was extremely friendly, all smiles, and provided GREAT conversation. Bartender was also very pleasant and the food runner was a delight as well. I didn't have to ask or want for anything. My only complaint is it took them FOREVER to finally send our server over to take our orders and the restaurant wasn't packed.   However, I still have yet to find somewhere here in the valley that fills the void of my southern heart. I will probably be yearning for good chicken until I go back to Nashville one day, but until then, these lackluster places will have to do.  Lo-Lo's has a wonderful vibe though and great interior, they even have a DJ playing all the old school jams making you and your party feel like you're vibing at a bingo night.   In my opinion, Lo-Lo's is leaps and bounds better than tacky, overrated, poor-service Roscoe's Chicken N Waffles of Los Angeles.

35qkZ5Jtkx4yh7eZysvWAg.text: We love Lolo's. We tried this location and were very disappointed. The waitress was horrible. This being a new location there was a back up in the kitchen and our food took longer than usual ok whatever. What was so bad about the experience was the waitress just disappeared didn't bring our drinks or say anything. We had to ask another waiter what was going on. We will bot be going back to this location and instead will drive the extra 1/2 hr to the Phoenix location!!

sQgYrC3DKzYeGgSJvjJgcA.text: Prices have gotten pretty expensive and the worst part is the parking.  They are in some sort of fight with re hotel (I believe the hotel is winning) and have VERY limited parking.  They did have a "complimentary" valet but, I didn't want them in my vehicle and have to tip them as well.

5nOf2I9unRznb_MJ6JQwnw.text: My co-worker wanted soul food and convinced me into coming here.  My first impression was that it was huge and clean.  The wait staff was friendly.  I ordered Puff's chicken tender basket with waffles and barbecue sauce.  The chicken tenders were big and delicious.  They were crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside.  The waffles were really good and I think it comes with real maple syrup as it wasn't the sticky corn syrup consistency as most restaurants serve.  I also ordered a sweet tea, which was served in a big mason jar.  I enjoyed myself here and will be back next time I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Puff&#39;s Chicken Tender Basket and sweet tea

OHpeVSPzz08CLXArg3LvIw.text: The place was packed when we arrived and we were seated within five(5) minutes. The service,atmosphere, and food was exceptional!!! When in Arizona this is a must visit!!! Soul food joint...LOL  Happy Feelings!!

EhnriwQpARAXj4Me7ubZWQ.text: Chicken and waffles is such a southern thing and yet I never partook during the number of years I lived in Atlanta. Not having a reference for the southern cuisine, I tried Lo-Lo's. I had the basic chicken and waffle and I don't know how they make their waffles, but it is absolutely amazing and the syrup is to die for. I enjoyed the chicken as well - not as much as the waffle, but it was a good combination none the less. It's a great treat now and then so I would recommend it if you are craving some good comfort food!

g0ATFpwzG2Qb489--QzYWQ.text: Visited Phoenix for the first time, and being a foodie, of course I looked up the most popular places to eat. Seeing that fried chicken is one of my absolute favorite foods, I had to find out what this city had to offer. Not only was this some of the best fried chicken I'd ever had, but the whole experience was so awesome that we ate at The the restaurant every day we were there and practically every meal! The staff was the absolute best too, so friendly and accommodating, I can hardly wait to visit again!

ssZVWGV9xUWNPH81klKmhA.text: Went here for our "date night". The experience didn't disappoint.  The location was clean and we were greeted as soon as we opened the door. The hostess was cheerful and seated us right away. Our server, Latisha, greeted us within a minute or two and took our drink order. I got a grape Kool-aid and the hubby got a Blue Ivy cocktail. My drink was cold and tasted like my childhood (I don't drink Kool-aid really ever anymore).  We ordered the fried green beans as an appetizer. They were very tasty especially with the dipping sauce that came with it.  I ended up ordering the Phat Azz samich with chicken and a side of corn. Hubby got the red velvet pancakes and a chicken breast. The food came out before we finished out appetizer; it was great.  My chicken was crispy, crunchy, and juicy and the corn was delicious. Hubby liked his pancakes (I tasted them too and they were delicious).  The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because the windows didn't seem to have shades on them and the setting sun made for a blinding experience where we were seated.

Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Buttered corn, chicken breast, sausage patties

dhc6JYD-HS0ViH2sfw0dsQ.text: I ordered the salmon croquettes which came w/eggs, grits, & toast for $18. I thought the food and service were pretty good. The place itself is nice. Next time I'll try the patio area. The music was just a little too loud for me at 9am. Although, if you have a mimosa or three it may not bother you as much. Complementary valet because of limited parking but I was fine w/that. Anywho, I shall return.

_89MyZcglfSWTpyFmeVe-Q.text: Believe it or not I have never had chicken and waffles before in my life. All my friends thought that was pretty crazy but honestly I just never got around to it. Until of course my friends dragged me to Lo-Lo's Chicken and Waffles.   I have got to say that this experience was really great. We sat and of course I just had some chicken and some waffles and everything was really amazingly delicious. The service was great the people were really friendly and everyone in our group had a great time.   Of course now I'll be coming back again and again because they have so much awesome stuff on this incredible menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

SUIUa7qRIbfPvDF3jY_nRA.text: Hmmm, Lo-Lo's wasn't as good as I remember. This was my third visit to the restaurant but my first to the Scottsdale location. I went on a Tuesday night and there was a podcast being recorded in the restaurant which made for a pretty loud environment. I asked several servers why that was the case and none could even name the podcast show so...yeah.  Anywho, the service was mediocre and so was the food. I saw another couple leave because it took so long for a server to acknowledge them. Either the result of being understaffed or poor training.   Nonetheless, this is a chain restaurant so I'm sure I would visit again if I was in the mood for what they offer but I'll be lowering my expectations moving forward.

VSvaCEpCtDVqKM0lHMcf0g.text: Summary:  Lack of customer service, toilet tasting water, funny tasting Lemonade, long wait no matter how many people, unsanitary, and no food quality control.   Detailed:  August 21, 2019: I had not eaten anything all day. Friends invited me to Lo-Lo's. At the restaurant, we were not greeted when entering (no one was at the front). After waiting a couple of minutes, our waitress sat us down. Not many people in the restaurant so I didn't understand the wait. We sat in the corner booth where the lightning wasn't so great (only booth available).  I got a lemonade and a water. Lemonade had a weird after taste and the water was straight up tap/toilet water.  I ordered the Aunt Portia's Chicken Omelette. We waited over 30 mins for the food to come out. Food comes out and waitress leaves. Doesn't come back to check up on us. I dug into my omelette and automatically realized that it was cold. It was obvious that it had been sitting somewhere for a while. I was too hungry so I continued to eat. After my third bite, I noticed a weird taste from the omelette. I figured it was just me and I kept eating. Still no check up from the waitress. Half way done, I decided to take a snap of my food to post it on to my Snapchat story. Took the pic and used flash. That's when I saw something weird under the cheese of the omelette. I peeled off the cheese and there it was.  The omelette was green and looked rotten (see attached pics). I didn't realize the omelette was green because of the lighting. Still no check up from waitress. My friends think they are boogie af and were embarrassed but I was not going to keep my mouth shut. I asked some other waitress to get our waitress. I complain and hand her the plate. Someone else comes out (I'm assuming the night manager/shift lead) and asks "who's omelette was that" with a concerned/slight disgust look on her face. I say "mine". She asked if I would like for them to remake it again and I said "no". At that point, I was disgusted and wanted to get the hell out of there.   DO NOT EAT HERE. It's not worth it. They also charge $3 for ONE chicken leg... go to KFC/Popeyes. At this point, KFC/Popeyes is healthier, faster and cheaper.  A health inspector needs to come to this restaurant. This place is unsanitary and disgusting. The people were nice though.   PSA: Do not eat here. If you do inspect your food!

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Aunt Portia&#39;s Chicken Omelet (with out flash)
Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Aunt Portia&#39;s Chicken Omelet (with flash)
Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Aunt Portia&#39;s Chicken Omelet (with flash)

r4wZxO6E1xAgCj_JLoKwaA.text: First, I'm a Southern Girl who can COOK.  I'm also the god daughter of a lauded professional chef.  In short, I know good food and I'm hyper critical when it comes to not only taste, but also service and presentation. I'd heard about the legendary food and long lines at LoLo's, so I hadn't made it in.   First, to avoid the crowds, go on Tuesday.   Second, the setting is like a comfy diner ...with cozy booths, smiling staff and just the right energy for you to feel welcomed.   Third, the menu is darlingly eclectic with dishes named after folk and burgers with hilarious names (I shoulda taken a pic), but I was too busy oooohing over the options.   I settled on the chicken fried chicken which was a huge breast with this so yummy you wanna bathe in it gravy. I had mashed potatoes and sweet potatoes (yes, two carbs ...I ignored my diet it was worth it!) I also had a great, crispy coleslaw that was the perfect balance of crunch and flavor.  The meal came with a huge, dayyyum it's good muffin.   I was too full for dessert, but I did save room for a second Georgia Peach Cocktail.  It's made with a peach infused vodka which was ok, but I much preferred the second when I asked for just Ciroc. With a full bar, I hey can whip up just about any cocktail.  Last, I'm glad I tried this place. But I'm surprised by some of the Yelp Reviews I just read. I think some folk have preconceived notions when it comes to comfort food/Soul Food.   This wasn't my cooking or my dad's, but that's what you have to expect when dining out. It's an op to see how another chef interprets a dish. Go in with a curiosity and respect for someone else's vision. And if you spend $10 at a fast food restaurant for pre frozen and in my opinion unbearably nasty food, why do you begrudge paying $20 for a full meal, cooked to order, and served on a plate?!

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Best cocktail EVER

jrfpk2F9LOeoYrPJywPdmA.text: It was National Waffle Day so we decided to try LoLo's new Scottsdale location. I've been to their first spot in Phoenix back when they first opened, and to Mrs. White's- so I know they strive and thrive. Unfortunately we were greeted by a rude hostess after trying to no avail to find parking. There are zero parking spaces available for LoLo's patrons due to the motel they share the property with. There is only a valet option, and that parking is limited, so I'm not sure how they possibly accommodate their patrons. The wait time on Yelp said 8-12 minutes and we arrived around 2pm well after the lunch or brunch crowd. We saw several empty tables, some clean, some dirty. The hostess grabbed a dirty wet rag that was laying on the desk, I assumed to clean a table for us, asked how many were in our party, then walked off. She returned, asked for our telephone number to notify us when a table would be ready. We asked how long, she answered 25 minutes. We were confused and walked the block back to our car to wait in cool place. We waited for about 30 minutes, and finally left. Never received a call or text that a table was waiting. It was also so warm inside the restaurant, I'm not sure we would have been comfortable eating. Very disappointing.

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Faux dessert display inside front entrance at LoLo&#39;s in Scottsdale, AZ.

YBUUrLKOkQ_kcmsek2g2NA.text: Le sigh. I was so excited to try this place out as my last food stop in my Phoenix trip but ended up in disappointment. I do not like giving places anything lower than 3 stars but I didn't enjoy my experience here.   We came at a busy time during Memorial Day weekend. We were seated at a high top table near the bar. We waited 25 minutes and nobody came to take our order. We had to flag someone down ... multiple times.   After we ordered, food came out fast. After we finished eating I found a hair in the bottom of my mashed potatoes. Le sigh.  The server apologized profusely for the wait time. The fried chicken itself is good though.

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

kwo0hGjO5_1v-eZW2EDcDw.text: My husband and I were visiting from Charlotte, NC. One of my sisters has talked very highly of this restaurant so we decided to go with her and see what it was about. There were four of us. When we arrived, there was a little bit of a wait but that's no problem with us. We were seated quicker than expected which was a nice surprise. The staff was all very friendly which is a great thing as always.   Our waiter was super busy and it took him a while to get to us. When he did, he made sure we got our drinks before he did anything else. I ordered water, my husband was crazy and decided to try the purple kool-Aid! My sister and her boyfriend both ordered the sweet tea. Everyone loved their drinks. I tried my husbands Kool-Aid and it was super sugary which was too much for me but I know he loved it! The sweet tea was pretty good! Still too sugary for my taste!   We ordered a good deal of food. I don't remember the name of all of our food. The online menu is not the same as the menu you are handed at the restaurant. I had 3 choices picked out and ALL 3 were not on the menu. When I asked about it I was told that the menu is old and out dated. If that's the case, take it down. It's not that hard to do. So there goes a star.   Our food took a long time to make. That's fine. I understand they were busy but there were tables that got filled after us and were getting their food long before we were getting ours. When asked about it, our server kept saying the kitchen is backed up. We had been waiting 45 minutes. There goes another star.   The food was not what I was hoping for. My eggs were over cooked. The potato's were bland and the grits were a huge disappointment. Better grits can be found at a restaurant called Butters. My husbands chicken was really dry. He liked the seasoning but it's kind of hard to enjoy the chicken when it's dry. My sisters boyfriend order was good. He enjoyed it but also said his 2 pieces of chicken were dry. The waffles were something he loved. My sister ordered the French toast and it was a little funky. Food being dry and over cooked was another reason for a star lost.   I was a little disappointed and I know my sister was since she talked so much about it. She usually goes to the other location but wanted to try this one since it was closer to us. It was worth a try but I don't plan to come back. The restaurant has a neat vibe to it. Wish the food was better during our visit.

z9o3CgitNkyQYoR5MqePxg.text: Omg ! I've been wanting to come and pig out here but I'm always watching what I eat. Welllll I'm watching what I eat alright .   our cute little bartender Symone  a great Patron Margarita - she was friendly and helpful and patient with our questions.  I was with my sister we got a sampler dish , corn fritters mmmm. Catfish strips yum and okra ! I felt like I was back in Memphis .  For a Thursday night they were I felt busy. Good place to watch sports - a lot of tvs .  Going to have dessert as soon as I can decide what it's going to be - then will waddle my way out of here and plan on the next time I'm cheating on my diet!!!!!  Uh oh - news flash Symone just talked me into some wings a dollar a wing !!!

vF4zQur6p8BqLelBFiVqeg.text: Visiting from So Cal and had to try this place.   The staff was friendly and helpful.   The restaurant has a fun atmosphere and comfortable.  Now for the food... I don't like eating chicken on a bone so I got the chicken tenders and waffle.  There was so much food two people could eat.   My son got the Macaroni and Cheese very flavorful and filling.   Can't wait to return when we come back in town.

FlPZXcJZ8-k_1UZC-fZgTg.text: So this is our go-to place for a cheat meal!  Fun atmosphere with family or friends or if you're dining solo, heck - sit at the bar!  On weekends when we have gone for lunch, they have a DJ playing fun jams.  Fried chicken is yummy and the adult beverages are on point.  Great spot for day drinking and eating if you ask me.    We've had the fried chicken (obviously), rotisserie, Chyna's honey hot wings (dry).  All yum and often times we don't have room for the corn bread, although it too is yummy!  I would rate overall 3.5 because service has been hit or miss.  Front of the house could use some help, but I do think most of the servers are friendly and helpful.  I actually think the service has been great for us when we have sat outside or at the bar.    So I would totes recommend coming here if you're in the mood for some fried chicken.  And if you're visiting and need soveniers for the fam, check out their t-shirts!

XY5LhGSWSbg7Gnwtyo-YmA.text: This place is bomb!!! A must stop whenever I'm in the Scottsdale area!  This time I got the soul food dinner with fried chicken and catfish, Mac and cheese, and collard green and even though I got white meat when I asked for dark the plate was still amazing. Everything about the food was on point but the Mac and cheese is some of the best Mac and cheese I've had at a restaurant!   Definitely save room for dessert or get it to go because the red velvet and banana pudding will speak to your soul. Gotta try the suck it to me cake next time I'm here

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Dinner  Lo-lo&#39;s Mix It up One Piece of Fish &amp; One Piece of Chicken

RvOb-9k5xxcTiU6qkzwhlg.text: The staff all around were nice and fast, our waitress, Nykki was great. I see a lot of reviews where the food was late but ours arrived quickly and was good and plentiful. Iced tea was very good. Neat place, loud but a good vibe and neat decor. Valet only, self-parking is nonexistent due to adjacent hotel.   Also, it's over 100 today and the valet guy is literally running his ass off in the blacktop parking lot taking care of everybody, but he could not be more attentive, cheerful and fast.

qH5k0rT8kxaeEVDusSjZYA.text: I would like to thank a couple of fellow Yelpers for recommending to me this fabulous restaurant! Being raised in the south, I love to try a southern themed restaurant whenever I can, especially if I'm in another region of the country. Some of my friends and I took a trip to the closest Lo-Lo's before leaving Phoenix and we all enjoyed our visit! If you're looking for some sweet tea, come to Lo-Lo's they make it right! They also have Kool-aid on the menu and comes with three flavors; fruit punch, watermelon, and grape.   For lunch, I wanted to try the main advertisement; chicken and waffles. I went with the menu item, Lo-Lo's since it came with three pieces of fried chicken and two good sized waffles. The chicken came out perfect, and had delicious seasoning and it wasn't dry at all! The waffles were fluffy and came with some syrup and butter. The portion was just right and the price wasn't bad either.  There are a few locations around Arizona, and we were told that the location in downtown Scottsdale gets pretty busy. This location wasn't too busy, so service was great! If I return to Phoenix again, I will return to Lo-Lo's.

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Squad!
Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lo-Lo&#39;s. Three pieces of fried chicken and two waffles.
Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sweet tea and Kool-aid. I love the Mason jars!

iauSyzwXI5MCFNkM-4_B0Q.text: Lo-Lo Chicken is a staple restaurant that EVERYONE needs to try out. All I can say is WOW! The warming satisfaction of comforting soul food is to die for. I order the famous soul food platter with a chicken thigh and fried fish  Mac and cheese and yams! This is True southern food, between the a little over the top salt content in the chicken, paired with the over baked 3 cheese macaroni and the juicy sweet yams I was amazed! I LOVED EVERYTHING! I would have love to pair my fish with a tartar sauce for extra flavor but it good just liked that. I did also get a whipped cream blue vodka drink which was amazing however a little on the sweeter side for me ! I went right before peak hours so the restaurant was not as crowded and the food came out relatively quickly. Two of the manager came and spoke to me which I am always a fan off! I will always recommend and visit again!

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

boYOe7Uc1XQXhWfmd8o1Rw.text: Soul food that is good for the soul but bad for the body. If you are looking for some True southern fried chicken (gravy and onions optional), collard greens, fried okra,  cornbread muffins cooked with creamed corn, macaroni and waffles, then this is the place for you.  It is connected with the legendary Mrs. Whites from downtown so you can get over priced koolaid as well.  The food is filling and heavy so I wouldn't get another small wing for $3.  The place has a great atmosphere with pics of history and family.  The menu names will make you smile and the food you eat will make you happy.  You can't go wrong if you are craving some good down home eats.  However, you might need to see your Primary Care Physician if you eat here too often!

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken special with 2 sides Three Pieces of Chicken (Southern Fried) and Smothered in Gravy &amp; Onions
Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. shrimp and Cheese Grits
Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. chicken n&#39; waffles

aVJUjvimNifLHlxDfwZloQ.text: finally was able to come in and check out the new Lo-Lo's for lunch with some work friends.  The building is so much nicer and has a great open feel with a fun vibe and music playing to keep the mood up.  I recently started a diet so this was one of my last meals and it didn't let me down.  I went with the Chicken fried chicken, mac and cheese, and mashed potatoes with corn bread.    The chicken fried chicken is actually the reason this didn't get 5 stars.  I expect when you order chicken at a place like this for it to be perfect and blow you away.  the breading was a little too much and the edges got overcooked and the chicken breast was a little dry.  The mac and cheese could have been a little creamier, seemed like it was left over from the day before and reheated, not the best but good flavor.  Potatoes were super smooth and seasoned perfect.  The corn bread was also perfect with a little bit of butter and honey.  all in all I walked away feeling fat and happy and will definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Koolaid on tap is always a good thing

ZGUQGEvvrL3KPiqf14Zg_g.text: I understand that there will always be a wait time for LoLo's chicken and waffles. It's a popular spot with great food at reasonable prices. What I don't understand is why I get my meat selection that comes along with my order when I've practically finished my order. Also the Togo order I placed at the beginning of my order didn't even come. That was my lunch for later today. Please be more prompt and efficient. I'd hate to stop coming.

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Carmel &amp; banana sweet stacked pancakes
Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Soulfood platter

cqX050_wb8gQ64xVMEFw2w.text: The. Absolute. Best!!!  I can't tell you enough how amazing Lo-Lo's is. First timers should always get their chicken platter. Chicken is so juicy and the batter is crispy and seasoned done right. You usually get two sides and you can't go wrong with any of them (and there's plenty to choose from). We always get a side of collard, Mac n cheese, cheesy grits, corn, green beans and of course their cornbread. We've tried them all and these are by far our favorites. Haven't gotten around to ordering dessert because the food was so good and bountiful that we are so stuffed we have to always pass on dessert. I see you peach cobbler, next time I will limit myself, I'll try.   But the last few visits I've been ordering their fried catfish. You get two HUGE filets! 2! TWO! Dos! Dalawa (for my Filipinos!)! It's about the size of the plate they serve it in. Crazy! But you know your girl ate it all. Every single crumb of it! Gone! And I washed it down with .... yup... grape Koolaid!!! They serve Koolaid on tap in tons of different flavors!!! How can they get any cooler? Endless refills and delicious comfort food, I love this place!!! It always is a special place in my heart. They remind me of home and how my family would eat dinner and have that huge pitcher of Koolaid. Thank you Lo Lo's for creating these memories for my own family.   To Larry "Lo-Lo",  How do I get you to open one in Orange County, CA. Please please please open one there!!! I'm telling you, you would be a huge hit because we don't have anything like you guys out where I live. I love coming to Scottsdale only for the purpose of eating at your restaurant. Please consider opening one near me!!! I swear you will be loved in my neighborhood!!   Your fans in California , Ellis Family

VMpX7DmbIyZzdD0L83G1vQ.text: Finally made it here after hearing good things from many others. It's on a weird corner next to a hotel so you have to cut through the hotel lot to get to it. As a result, they also have complementary but forced valet because they want to define hotel vs restaurant parking. Was a bit annoying though because it looked to me like there was enough spaces for everyone to park themselves. Anyways..  We got inside and there was no wait (yay!) around 11am on a Sunday. We were promptly seated and looked over the menu. It took our waiter a minute to greet us but he was apologetic and look clearly overwhelmed. He was nice and got our drinks back to us shortly after. We had coffee, cranberry juice and unsweetened tea.   Two of us ordered the Double D (two breast and a waffle) and my friend ordered the Toy Toy which came with two wings and a waffle. We also ordered a side of Mac n cheese and whipped potatoes to try. The chicken and waffles came with butter and syrup. I thought the food was fantastic. The chicken was really good, crispy and not overly greasy. The waffles had awesome flavor and together it was a heavenly combo. The Mac n cheese was pretty solid and the potatoes were seasoned and fairly tasty. I'd order the Mac n cheese again but probably not the potatoes.   Overall I was happy with the meal but service was a bit slow. Our waiter was nice but it took awhile to get checks and he definitely seemed stressed. The valet was kind of annoying too but the food was worth it. I would definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

0197GC91UtUWVZk2-ZWVRA.text: I go to Scottsdale from time to time to get surgery, because that's what Scottsdale is known for. So night before my operation I went here with four others and we all got different items.   I really love this place. It started out right with the very large beverage sizes, just what I like. I had a salad with bacon on it and avocado also and pieces of boneless fried chicken. I almost wanna cry just thinking about it because it was so good. I put some of their house brand hot sauce on the chicken, wow that was good.   Our server was so kind, I love her to death, she was just good vibes. The decor was cool also and the location was just a few steps away from the hotel I stayed at. My parents loved the food so much they went there the next day also.   The waffle was amazing, I ate some of my mom's, and I loved the banana bread pudding for desert. Wow! Great spot, I can see now why they're a success. I would go here all the time if I was local.

WqjxxQmdaiZuJeFo7gnLkA.text: I love this place! When you are craving soul food and some yummy chicken and waffles this is the place! I recommend a soul platter, sides of fried okra and whipped potatoes.

bdf4dxBvAx8v-L_CAucgJQ.text: I had a professor that was always raving about this place. I'm the person everyone can count on to order chicken everywhere I go, so I knew I needed to see what all the fuss was about.  I honestly can't believe it took me as long as it did to come in! This place is amazing! I'm not a huge fan of waffles in general, but figured I needed to try it once. They were so good! The chicken strips were moist and flavorful, without being greasy. The kool-aid was an added bonus!   My next trip in, I tried the macaroni and cheese, and fries instead of the waffle. Both were great as well! The macaroni was smooth and perfectly cheesy, and the fries were seasoned to perfection. My friend had the Double D, and that was great as well.  I highly recommend this place; I've been talking about it non-stop to my parents back home, and can't wait for them to come into town so I can take them here.  My only complaint would be the parking lot. I mean really? Valet for that tiny parking lot really doesn't make sense. And it's annoying trying to find somewhere to park on a Friday night.

efcrF1cV_OY-9kA4iVB7mg.text: Maybe I'm a little biased because I'm from Louisiana, home of the fried chicken. The chicken was OKAY, for $4 a piece it's a little pricey. The waffles were thin enough to be crunchy, just how I like it. The cheese grits? Hard pass. It's literally melted cheese and a block of butter on plain grits. I was expecting grits cooked with cheese and butter, yes it does make a difference. Huge difference. The kool aid was sweet. Like slap of diabetes sweet. All the waiters were great except for mine. She dropped off my food and she was staring at the door. When I said thank you, she must have realized I was there and said enjoy your meal, to the door. She dropped off my check and a to go box. But another waitress had to pick up my check and get me a larger to go box. I wanted a bag to put my to go box in, I guess after I pay I don't get anymore help because she was no where to be seen.  Overall, okay food and one of the worst service I've experienced.

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. DD with kool aid and cheese grits.

JtTv2IOh5ltAqEdQYHR09g.text: Im  fan of lolos on South Central.  I thought I'd give this new location a shot.   My food took a long time,  I've seen my food come faster on a busy night,  and I was there on a slow night.   Second of all,  I got red velvet cake,  to go like I always do.  It was a TINY piece, not to mention,  it tasted like it had been sitting on the counter for two weeks.  Just horrible.    Not convinced to return to this location.

BA8C1TQeGIoZUYjjK-L90g.text: Yes to the Fried Chicken & Waffles, banana pancakes, cornbread, biscuits and collard greens! One of the best biscuits I have had ever!!! And I consider myself a biscuit connoisseur. Truly a rare find in the Phoenix Area. Valet parking is available at the Scottsdale location. Also loved the blue koolaid and banana pudding

Te0iT0Nlqa3liabSImaoJQ.text: I have been coming to this chain for years. Until the prices started getting high. I remember when the soul food platter was $13.50 now it is $17. I came here with my 1 yr old and my 13 yr old, we waited over an hr for our food. The people next to me came in after me, and got their food before I did and left as we were getting our food. Finally my food came out it was warm not hot freshly waiting for hr made. The chef came out and said he would take care of my bill. The waitress brought me my bill... he only comp'd the drinks. Never again.

PD6ckORLqGUfJyvEBjvK7Q.text: Visited the Scottsdale location twice and wasn't impressed either time.  So loud with people talking over the already very loud music piped throughout the restaurant that we had to ask that the music be turned way down so that Grandma with her hearing Aides could stay.  The noise was making her ill.    The food was salty and served cold.  Horrible parking situation as well!  Wont come to this location again.

eZm9ETcM0-W9_DZ4WR6S5w.text: What a great place to discover the chicken and waffles dish. The Mac & Cheese is also excellent and so is the service.  For those rare occasions when I crave fried chicken, I'll go to Lo-Lo's to satisfy it.

YPx3pClIbCajgkXtbsIj2w.text: Lunch was awesome The chicken  and waffles we utterly amazing  the chicken was so juicy had use three napkins, the waffles were so tasty  Maria was fabulous the service was excellent........ Will be back asap

uLMm00NwW52O-uaY9pO_yw.text: Thank you so much Lo-Lo's! I've been suffering from morning sickness for the past few weeks so eating has not been my favorite activity lately. After being in bed most of the day, I was craving some comfort food. And boy need y'all come through for me! Not to mention our server Bre was super sweet and professional. My two year old son also took a liking to her. He said he liked her hair and she was pretty. Y'all will probably be seeing me often.

cm1LSCIpzUJtBXWTMS4wyw.text: Trendy decor in this cute southern style spot. Chicken was finger-licking good! Waffles were yummy. Mac and cheese was creamy like Velveeta mac n cheese and not baked with breadcrumbs on top like I expected in a southern restaurant. Our server seemed distracted so we weren't enthused about the service but the manager checked in on us and got us our food immediately after noticing we had been waiting for a while. Recommended for sure. I would definitely go back if I lived here but I'm just visiting from NJ!

NYuHgjLStTPa7jXu5NllKA.text: I've gone here 4 times for breakfast and they are suppose to open at 9:00am. We've gone anywhere from 9:10-9:30am and the doors are never open. Employees are inside, but don't open the door. One time I called that night in hopes to let the owners know, but the manager that was working the AM shift answered and said he couldn't find the keys. Seems to be a consistent problem since this is the 4th time (not exaggerating) this has happened. It's a shame because it's a nice place with great breakfast. Ever time this has happened, they lose the 8-10 customers waiting outside to US Egg across the street. Hope the owner finds out and fires the AM manager for clearly not caring about this business or reputation.

0KWig_wMuQAHj4i3LRAlgQ.text: I love the large lemon Aid with the fried Catfish to wash it all down.

f1Skr54ctSmKv5vs6JxcnA.text: Love the new location!  Love the chicken! Not a fan of the waffles, but to each his own.  The menu is great with a lot of options.

JpgJUaT2mOHmBK00ilNCwA.text: Service is sooooo slow! Food is ok, I'm not sure if it lives up to the hype. I'm not sure if we will try it again or not.

avDSOVkymURdTR7Rt9CcBA.text: The food is good but not worth the unexplainable long wait. I've been here twice now and both times it has taken well over forty minutes to receive a simple breakfast. The bartenders are equally as slow and take a very long time to just take an order. The Bloody Mary is the worst I've ever had, and even the bartender admitted that the mix they use is crap.   Also, having to pay a valet to go to a fried chicken restaurant is ridiculous.

jpVznbZI0zxT6-C6U3FhTg.text: OMG where do I begin.... Let's get the bad stuff out the way first... I waited almost an hour for my food because they had a big group in.... I was disappointed but the food was worth the wait!! The manager came over and gave me my meal free... That was a nice gesture to make the situation right...I ordered the 3 piece platter (I think that's what it's called) with cornbread and 2 sides (collard Greens and rice and butter) sweet tea... They even have kool aid on tap but u have to order by the color...lol... The food was worth the wait... Absolutely fantastic!!! One thing I love is that the greens are not seasoned with pork!!!! Definitely a plus

b2umKgQZ2hP0MlFmoIPgsw.text: It's very unfortunate. New location is nice. Enjoy the drinks and atmosphere. However it took 15 minutes at the bar before a drink order even started. Two drinks later or 30 minutes and still no appetizers. The service is slow slow slow. They are way understaffed. It's not the staffs fault that service sucks it the management. Absolutely pathetic. Ohhhh and the parking is a joke. Plan on parking a block away because the hotel next door takes all the parking. I will NOT return. I will miss it but will Not be back.

n57jDpGN5Ypv33Jo61OVRw.text: Summary: chicken was dry, overcooked, lacking meat.  So I ordered 2 thighs (Lil C) with Mac-and-Cheese with a side of okra. My two chicken thighs were dry, not moist at all. I believe they were over cooked because the coating has a slight burnt flavor (not bad, but not light and crispy). And then there was the lack of meat. Must be buying skinny chickens!  On a plus side the Mac-and-Cheese was good; cheesy, rich, and done just right. The fried okra was very good too. Crispy, with a cornmeal batter, and not a hit of the okra-snots (if you like okra, you know what I'm talking about).

BgV-ZXkP6zQ9CFbk38l8rQ.text: Parking was plentiful!  Prices seem about the same when it comes eating a southern type places.  Waiter was awesome very helpful with any questions about the menu.  Mimosa was off the hook.  Food was very good!

7XnnOTXspR9AWOq7omy3fw.text: Food was delicious but the service was even better. Neal made the experience a 10/10. Super fun and friendly, just a great person. He recommended the platter with the mac n cheese. Sooooo delicious. But yeah a great time and excellent service. Neal gets a raise.

jyLLR835TqFaUgxzeR0Igw.text: This is a very good restaurant I would recommend the ice tea it is amazing and don't order anything else besides chicken and waffles

Vh_nP2yTkcTgUExfFLoi9g.text: Family recipes. Old school soul food. Just like down south - sweet sweet tea, great collards, sweet sweet yams.  Fried chicken like Gma made. Waffles like home. Good food

V2LWqHEtBhCCVFggq0GIfA.text: Good service. Good food. Still thinking of those fried green tomatoes . Parking is a little challenging. Good luck

GAtWi5OVy_RY-f1pOlZsPw.text: This place is a good casual option for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Kids menu is a little sparse, but they love the Kool-Aid drinks. Regular menu has plenty to choose from, but mostly southern classics - salmon croquettes, mac-n-cheese, fried green beans, and of course Chicken & Waffles.  If you aren't interested in the fried items, they also have salads, burgers, etc.  I've had only one of their lighter options, the egg white omelet, which is extremely tasty.  Seating is plentiful and spacious.  But if you come on weekend, still expect a wait. Classic R&B in the background helps to set the tone.  Saturday afternoons they even have live DJs.

v4Cd4wt9TnRy5YOLqs0oUQ.text: Soul food without the soul. Waffles were microwaved. Chicken was too. Flavorless. Great service from our waiter. Collared Greens were hopeless

DFunNTY8U5OMurc0023RfQ.text: This was our first time at Lo-Lo's and we were not disappointed at all.  Staff were very friendly and the food was amazing - we liked everything we tried! Prices were reasonable and we would recommend calling in if ever you're in the Old Town Scottsdale area!!

CCwGE2k_t4nhbXLBv46MDQ.text: Chicken was great as always. but the best part was being taken care of by Mike. He did an outstanding job,   was extremely friendly and cheerful. A great person.

PstHrHnaB0nAbNYVmjPjtg.text: I have come to downtown Scottsdale location a few times for breakfast after work, when I am craving some chicken and waffles. Food and service is good. I will come back again.

0-8HgPpeZjD4dDjlFic4ow.text: Has Lo-Lo's lost its roots?  Super disappointed.  I love this place and I love soul food.  Been here many times.  However today was a real let down.  It was later in the day about 1:00pm on a Saturday.  Initially the restaurant was busy but not more then our previous trips.  We were told it would be a 25 minute wait to be seated for our party of six.  At about 35 minutes we asked how much longer and she said she was getting a table ready and even pointed to it.  She gave it away abut 15 minutes later.  We asked again.  Same thing.  At this point the restaurant was at about 50% capacity.  We got a table after reminding her again for a third time and then got our waitress who seemed to be on the same slow regimen as the hostess.  We put in our order.  Time slipped by and we told our waitress we were concerned.  The "chef" came out and I told him we were dissatisfied and he argued with me that the order had been put in 37 minutes earlier and they had a large party outside.  I told him we had been there for 90 minutes total in the restaurant and he was less then sympathetic.  In fact I felt he was quite put out by us. Now I cook waffles at home and I'm sure the collard greens are made in large quantities before hand so I'm not sure even 37 minutes is necessary to get the food to the table and I believe the whole experience was a series of small errors in the flow from the hostess to the waitress to the kitchen but to deny there was an issue and blame it on us degraded the experience to the point where we cancelled our order and left hungry.  So how low can you go? Lo-lo's!

rbAexp8G-DlGZCWLAcvysg.text: So I was cruising around today trying to find a place to eat lunch before a doctor's appointment when I drove past Lo-Lo's Chicken and Waffles. I have never eaten here before so I did a u turn and pull into the parking lot. When I walked into this brightly lite restaurant I was greeted right away by the hostess who took me to a booth.  Aaron my waiter showed up within a few minutes and took my drink request. I was going to get chicken until I saw someone else get the French toast.  My order came really fast. I like the fact that you can get breakfast anytime of the day. OMG my french toast melted in my mouth!!!!! Aaron was very attentive and checked up on me a lot. Other wait staff also asked if I needed anything,( a sign of good training. ) Would I come back here again? Yes,yes and yes

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Dining room
Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. French toast
Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Dining room

ms0APVLCobX25QDh8RL4xw.text: This place is good. Nice atmosphere and friendly servers. The night we went was pretty busy so the service was kinda slow but our nice server definitely made up for that.  Now the food was super yummy! Chicken was right and crispy, mac n cheese super yum and the banana pudding was to die for.

SFhuWV1_eFqmQVau0v8scg.text: Mrs. White's was closed. so had to go to LoLo's. Previous time there when it first moved from other scottsdale location...food was kind of "whityfied". This time...place was very busy and we waited a little longer than usual and then really waited a long time for the food to arrive. We were given some corn bread and that was helpful...but it was an excessively long wait. The manager gave an explanation and we were given desserts to go. The food was much improved from our first visit to this location. Much more like Mrs. Whites as I hope her family is involved with this location. Much better sides and the chicken was better. But nothing replaces Mrs. Whites. I like the workers there and the comfort of the place... ok if you are dying for soul food but watch out for busy times. get better service and food at Mrs. Whites.

irVaE48qk9oxgZiVzV-Jpg.text: When I went, it wasn't too busy but it took awhile for the waitress so take our order and retrieve our sauce. I would understand if it was busy but that's not a big inconvenience in the long run. The chicken was moist and juicy. It was good by itself, but not combined with the waffle since that took away the taste. The waffles were just... waffles. There wasn't anything special about the two together, but that may be because I never really was into the chicken and waffle craze. Parking was a bit difficult to find because it is right next to a hotel and a lot of the spots are reserved, but after circling a few times, we got lucky and found one.

5e3Ds_9-6GEqIowbClNDYQ.text: This place was great. Parking not so much, but it's nice they have a free valet parking service. Came here for lunch and we were seated almost immediately (the spring training game was still playing, but from what we heard the place gets nuts at other times). I ordered some blue Kool-Aid and Lo-Lo's which is two chicken and two waffles. Out waiter was nice he wasn't the most personable, but he was hustling so many tables I didn't mind I was in good company regardless. The Kool-Aid was so so so good! I haven't had Kool-Aid this good in a long time. It was a hot day and it literally hit the spot. The chicken was good and the waffles were nice and fluffy. I've had chicken and waffles before and I'll admit this isn't the best chicken and waffles I've ever had (that award is still Roscoes in So Cal), but man was it close! Good location and I was stuffed. I will definitely revisit this place again if I am back in this area again!

SGvF1E5HfytBuefUQ9BduA.text: Delectable fried chicken, collard greens & cornbread! Wishing there was a Lo-Lo's back home in MO!

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yum!

T93WxlxxA-bVJr2tEBX3oQ.text: I like the food; however, it has become a parking lot turf war between the motel next door and Lolo's.  The result, Motel Parking sings EVERYWHERE and painted on most of the spots in Lolo's parking lot. I fear no matter wherever I park I might be towed.  Lolo's has responded by blocking off the few spots that they do own with VALET parking.  The result, you end up paying as much to park as you do for one of their breakfasts.  Sad day. I opted to leave and eat elsewhere.

KLdaQ2HztXTuGu7Pc_2FAA.text: Really good chicken and waffles, fast to go ordering, just hate that there is no to go parking, had to tip valet for a 2 second parking job. Not a good place to take friends and family on a Saturday or Sunday morning, insanely busy and they don't take reservations. Would like to go back and eat inside at a slower time during the week.

V-4zxxgwWngbJD1P_kt_8A.text: Great food. Great music. Excellent service. Waffles were not too sweet. Chicken was fried perfectly and loved the cornbread & catfish.

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Have a fireplace and indoor/outdoor bar too!
Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. New location-great atmosphere. Love chicken n waffles!

rGOKYPTbN6RND1X8-sP_qQ.text: Kinda disappointed. People always rush to try chicken and waffle spots when they see one especially people from the south. When I first moved to PHX from Houston (Texas), came in here and thought I would get some southern style chicken.....nah not at all, food was not seasoned well- very bland- even had friends in town, they said the same. Friends even mentioned, no need to rush back when they get back in town. I got three wings and a waffle and that's about......it......

SV3XVRruA-MsW6TFzEYLig.text: Excellent southern food with a flare. Can't go wrong with anything that I've had. Catfish, chicken, fried green tomatoes, waffles, Oreo pancakes are perfect.

Uj_bqBG-pcVSHZWDo94U-g.text: Called and they said they close at 11. Drove 30mins to get there, arrived at 10:20 and they said on a Saturday night " sorry we closed early today"... and they were still serving people. First time to try this place never again.

wg-Tvh6MAExMDpq_Z9SyQw.text: Had their Betty Boob (chicken breast and waffle with butter and syrup) along with sides of whipped potatoes, collared greens, and mac n' cheese. Service was friendly. Their award winning hot sauce was delicious. Chicken was a little dry, but overall everything tasted quite good.

v3dyAck-1nnJfbifX0gs_g.text: Food is good as always, but today I think they needed to hire a few dishwashers. It took them a minute for them to bring out our eating utensils, after asking and after we got our food served.

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

V9xRcq6F1DVqEppiP-YoTg.text: I was honestly craving chick fil a. I have never eaten before, and I am surprised by their quality of food. I order their chicken tenders, which were extremely moist and asked for the fries to be slightly season. They were mind blowing. I also had the mac & cheese which was delicious with a mushroom -based sauce, that you can hardly taste

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken tenders and fries

u19NblIacjmc5XrffI70pg.text: Good food but won't come back for the service. The length of time we had to wait from ordering to receiving our food, I probably could have made my own chicken and waffles. Staff are constantly gathering among themselves that they'd disregard customers. All in all, left with stomach aches waiting so long to eat.

4mdq5KD2aALjR1VRZnGqXQ.text: I just got back from getting some "to go" food from LoLo's Scottsdale location. Gabe was slinging drinks @ the bar & Ian was the MOD. I ordered 2 of the "Soul food platters" dinners, 1 was all dark meat w/2 sides (double rice & beans) & the other was chicken strips w/2 sides of smothered potatoes. The food was absolutely SPECTACULAR! Thanks to Gabe & Ian for a GREAT to go food experience!

0YhiF0KKUc7Hymch71Alpw.text: There was a lot of hype about this place, so decided to check it out. The food and atmosphere was amazing, I got the red kool aid and chicken n waffles.  On the other hand, the service was crap. The host was rude and had a snarl on her face as she finally decided to seat us. And the server was nice, but messed up our order, no big deal. But never came to check back on us, zero refills. We practically had to beg for the check to leave. I was disappointed.  I even read reviews beforehand, they are accurate about the service.

yDKR2YA1PVPPtEtbB6_MEQ.text: New Years Day experience: The kitchen was totally unprepared for crowds. 45 minute wait for food. Greeter and wait staff friendly.  Kept apologizing for delay. Several folks asked to speak to manager to complain but no one showed up to talk to customers. Huge delays, kitchen absolutely unorganized. Worst dinner experience and we've been coming here for years. Who's managing the kitchen staff? No one!!!

1jHoQtrTL3hMZ8UfSkxJ2w.text: Horrible experience, waited 30 minutes for a table. Took 30 minutes for a waitress to come over. Because the waitress across the way couldnt handle more than 3 booths and wouldnt serve us because it wasnt her "section".  Latisha was great, she is the reason why i gave 2 stars.

Uy0OujkMEay5V2opAKU3HQ.text: This is the best damn chicken and waffles spot, period. Living in Southern California there are plenty of places to get fried chicken, and many of them have waffles included, but the only one worth going to is Roscoe's, which is a must for anyone visiting SoCal.   However, the first time I tried Lo-Lo's, my mind was fuckin' blown away. They literally blow Roscoe's out of the water. I have NEVER had a bad experience with the service or the food at Lo-Lo's and if I could, I would eat that shit EVERY fuckin day! The chicken is so juicy and so tender while the outside is crispy and not flaky or drowning in oil like at so many other fried chicken joints. Their mac-n-cheese was also mouth watering with the globs of cheese they cover it in and their biscuits that were drowning is sausage gravy are as soft and fluffy as Charmin.   That being said, the absolute BEST part that won me over and is literally making me want to visit Arizona at least once a month JUST to eat at Lo-Lo's was their gat damn grape Kool-Aid!! Holy mother of all things delicious!! This shit was the perfect combination of Kool-Aid, sugar, and ice cubes. I seriously wanted to buy a gallon of this stuff to take back home. If it's a hot summer day and you're thirsty as fuck then this shit will quench your thirst like it's the first time you've ever had liquid in your body. Don't think about visiting this joint just fuckin' do it and thank me later.

NB0STSVD8lTfXyY1UhjwmA.text: I went here yesterday with my wife, son, and father. First of all I will say that the service was amazing. Everyone was very friendly and was attentive to our needs. The chicken was juicy and golden brown, I was expecting a little more seasoning, but none the less was amazing. I got the soul food platter with mac n cheese and greens. I usually hate greens from restaurants, but these greens were perfect!  My wife got the 3 piece chicken and waffles with a side of cheese grits. All the food was great. Just moved to the area in July 2015 and this is my new number one spot!
